channel.title: Comments on: What Would Eric Pride Do?
channel.description: BDSM, books and missing links by Xiao Yingtai

item.title: By: How to handle “the fear” when you embark on being a deviant | CAVA Supernova
item.dc:creator: How to handle “the fear” when you embark on being a deviant | CAVA Supernova
item.description: […] Check out this great post What Would Eric Pride Do? from University of Abject Submission, which makes loads of interesting points about fear too. (And […]
item.content:encoded: […] Check out this great post What Would Eric Pride Do? from University of Abject Submission, which makes loads of interesting points about fear too. (And […]

item.title: By: Xiao Yingtai
item.dc:creator: Xiao Yingtai
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/what-would-eric-pride-do/#comment-337">Amy Juicebox</a>.
Thank you! I wonder if the reason is that when I do hug, I make like a limpet? I actually have a tendency to stumble afterwards if not steadied by a helpful hand. It represents a lot of intimacy for me.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Amy Juicebox.

Thank you! I wonder if the reason is that when I do hug, I make like a limpet? I actually have a tendency to stumble afterwards if not steadied by a helpful hand. It represents a lot of intimacy for me.

item.title: By: Amy Juicebox
item.dc:creator: Amy Juicebox
item.description: i too am stuck on the hug thing. what a tenuous line intimacy is... great post. :)
item.content:encoded:
i too am stuck on the hug thing. what a tenuous line intimacy is…
great post. :)

item.title: By: Xiao Yingtai
item.dc:creator: Xiao Yingtai
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/what-would-eric-pride-do/#comment-305">Ng Yi-Sheng</a>.
Thank you! I've been neglecting found literary BDSM lately, but it's supposed to be one of the themes of this blog. There are two posts in the pipeline, one about <a href="http://www.bartleby.com/142/316.html" title="Not My Enemies Ever Invade Me" rel="nofollow">love and this Walt Whitman poem</a> and <a href="/pain-is-a-battering-bastard-and-more-part-1/" title="Tortures" rel="nofollow">chronic pain and this Wisława Szymborska poem</a>. I guess we are both into unexpected intersections. :)
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Ng Yi-Sheng.

Thank you! I’ve been neglecting found literary BDSM lately, but it’s supposed to be one of the themes of this blog. There are two posts in the pipeline, one about love and this Walt Whitman poem and chronic pain and this Wisława Szymborska poem. I guess we are both into unexpected intersections. :)

item.title: By: Ng Yi-Sheng
item.dc:creator: Ng Yi-Sheng
item.description: I love how you worked in that Pride and Prejudice quote!
item.content:encoded: I love how you worked in that Pride and Prejudice quote!

item.title: By: Xiao Yingtai
item.dc:creator: Xiao Yingtai
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/what-would-eric-pride-do/#comment-250">jamielakenovels</a>.
[blink] I have no idea! But then I don't think he was questioning those things on purpose.
Your book covers certainly feature some impressive models.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to jamielakenovels.

[blink] I have no idea! But then I don’t think he was questioning those things on purpose.

Your book covers certainly feature some impressive models.

item.title: By: jamielakenovels
item.dc:creator: jamielakenovels
item.description: Interesting post! It's not everyday that you have to think about what a hug is. What do you think he will bring up to question next?
item.content:encoded: Interesting post! It’s not everyday that you have to think about what a hug is. What do you think he will bring up to question next?
